entry.title: ROSEBURG EXPECTING AT/NEAR NORMAL HIGH TEMPERATURES THROUGH FRIDAY
entry.summary: June 23, 2025 3:50 a.m. The Umpqua Valley is expecting at or near normal high temperatures through Friday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that weak high pressure will lead to sunny dry conditions with afternoon highs between 80 and the mid-80s. The normal high...

entry.title: CITY COUNCIL MEETING STARTING EARLY MONDAY
entry.summary: June 23, 2025 3:40 a.m. The Roseburg City Council’s Monday meeting will begin early. Councilors will gather at 6:30 p.m. to interview two applicants for the Planning Commission. Andy Stoner and David Bolhuis have both applied. When the regular meeting begins at 7:00 p.m. the council will make a selection or decide to consider soliciting...

entry.title: SPRING 2025 CITY CONNECTION NOW ONLINE

entry.title: LOCAL BOYS & GIRLS CLUB RECEIVES $90,000 GRANT FOR NEW PROGRAM
entry.summary: June 23, 2025 3:20 a.m. The Boys & Girls Club of the Umpqua Valley has been awarded a $90,000 Community Health Improvement Plan grant from Umpqua Health Alliance to launch a pilot Youth Workforce Development program for students in 4th through 8th grade students. A release said the 2YWD initiative will begin in summer 2025...

entry.title: 8TH ANNUAL LAVENDER FESTIVAL & FARM TOUR COMING IN JULY
entry.summary: June 23, 2025 3:05 a.m. The 8th annual Lavender Festival & Farm Tour is coming up next month. Presented by Growing Miracles Lavender Garden, the event will include 80 artisan vendors, u-pick lavender, yoga in the lavender, food vendors, a lavender lemonade stand and more. entry.title: EXPERIENCE ROSEBURG MURAL PROJECT WELCOMES NEW MURALS
entry.summary: June 23, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Experience Roseburg Mural Project has announced the installation of two new murals in downtown Roseburg. A release said both murals are created by nationally recognized artists whose work celebrates the spirit and natural beauty of the great outdoors. entry.title: CONGRESSMAN BENTZ ISSUES STATEMENT ON RECENT BOMBING OF IRAN
entry.summary: June 22, 2025 2:50 p.m. On Sunday, Congressman Cliff Bentz released a statement on the recent bombing of Iran. Bentz said, “I support President Trumps decision to use our military to damage and hopefully destroy Iran’s immediate capacity to produce nuclear weapons. entry.title: ROSEBURG RECEIVES FIRST MEASURABLE RAIN IN A MONTH
entry.summary: June 21, 2025 7:50 a.m. Roseburg received its first measurable rain in a month on Friday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that .08 inches of precipitation was recorded at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The last rain came on May 20th when .02 of precipitation...
